abstract: Average revenue rose 4.1 percent in the first half of the year, according to Citi Private Bank’s quarterly report on the legal industry.
snippet: Average revenue rose 4.1 percent in the first half of the year, according to Citi Private Bank’s quarterly report on the legal industry.
lead_paragraph: An increase in revenue for law firms in the first half of this year came largely from higher lawyer billing rates rather than greater demand for services, according to Citi Private Bank’s quarterly report on the legal industry.

headline.main: Higher Fees Increase Law Firm Revenue by 4.1 Percent
headline.print_headline: Higher Fees Increase Law Firm Revenue by 4.1 Percent
